<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Elaborate Flourish](/Feats.aspx?ID=1813) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Metamagic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=107" />
<trait label="Sorcerer" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=148" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 139 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

You embellish your spellcasting with entrancing flourishes and grand pronouncements, making it harder to identify or counter. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell, creatures with the ability to Cast that Spell don't automatically know what the spell is. In addition, creatures that witness your spellcasting take a –2 circumstance penalty to checks to identify the spell with [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26) and checks to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) the spell during its casting (such as with [Counterspell](/Feats.aspx?ID=633)).
name: Elaborate Flourish
